title: iDigital
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from iDigital, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: My wife and I are in our 50s and have $11 million. We’re not leaving it to our kids. Is that wrong?
items.description: “We have retired from full-time work.”

items.title: Opendoor’s stock is rocketing again. What can make it keep going?
items.description: Opendoor shares are skyrocketing again as noted bull Eric Jackson said that the company needs to dive deeper into AI and rethink its business model.

items.title: The looming crisis of AI speed without guardrails
items.description: The future will arrive with or without our guardrails. We must design AI’s structures now for a future of abundance rather than disruption.

items.title: GEPA optimizes LLMs without costly reinforcement learning
items.description: Moving beyond the slow, costly trial-and-error of RL, GEPA teaches AI systems to learn and improve using natural language.

items.title: My aunt barely spends any money. Will we receive the contents of her safe-deposit box when she dies?
items.description: “I am asking for my mom, who is on a fixed income. It would be a nice boon.”

items.title: Hugging Face: 5 ways enterprises can slash AI costs without sacrificing performance
items.description: Ultimately, model makers and enterprises are focusing on the wrong issue: They should be computing smarter, not harder.

items.title: Palantir’s stock is sliding. Here’s why this short-seller thinks even a $40 price tag is ‘generous.’
items.description: Andrew Left argues that investors have overhyped Palantir stock, and its valuation pales in comparison to a true AI leader like OpenAI.

items.title: My friend’s father gifted her Tesla and Google stock. They could be worth millions. Will they be split 50/50 in her divorce?
items.description: “My friend is working on an exit plan.”
